intro: Horkelia saxosa, commonly known as the saxosa horkelia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family and typically grows in rocky or gravelly habitats. The plant produces small, bell-shaped blue or violet flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and is often found in mountainous regions. Horkelia saxosa is adapted to harsh environments and is considered a rare and endangered species in some areas.
